lead_paragraph: SONNENFELD--Nathan J. "Sonny." 96, hailed as a legendary lighting industry salesman, educator, mentor, consultant and writer, died peacefully at home on February 10, 2016. Born in New York he began his career as technical director at the 92nd Street YMCA. In 1940 he was drafted and earned a Silver Star for his United States Army service in the Pacific. After the War he returned to New York to begin work at Century Lighting, later becoming a founding partner of Lighting & Electronics and selling dimming equipment for various companies until he joined Electronic Theatre Controls as a consultant. He was President of the New York section of Illuminating Engineering Society, a founding member of USITT and received its 2016 Distinguished Achievement Award. He founded Broadway Lighting Master Classes and Stage Lighting Super Saturday. He is survived by a brother Irving, a sister Naomi Hirsch, his partner Jennifer Tipton, a son Barry, a daughter-in-law Susan, and a granddaughter Chloe. 1/3
